chargeHist.descr: Allow Use as Place of Prostitution

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan M. Nicolazzi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan M. Nicolazzi is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan M. Nicolazzi was found guilty of Allow Use as Place of Prostitution, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.34(2).
  • Ryan M. Nicolazzi was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for 177 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Cooperate and successfully complete Behavioral Health Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Tenuta.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  The court reviews the defendant's right to recusal as Judge Kerkman presided over treatment court; defendant waives recusal.  Sentencing arguments heard. On count 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 3 years WSP; 2 years initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision w/conditions.  On count 2, the court imposes a total sentence of 2 years WSP; 1 year initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision w/conditions, concurrent with count 1.  Credit for 399 days.  DE is eligible for CIP/SAP.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant.  Costs remaining to be paid during extended supervision.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jerald Breitenbach.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Counts 1 & 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 3 - Dismissed by the State.  DE enters into the Behavioral Health Treatment Program and sentencing arguments are made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions.  Credit for 177 days if revoked.   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given. Review Hearing on 5/5/16 at 3:30 PM.
Plea hearing on April 27, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
